thread.title: Airbnb gives rugby fans chance to sleep over at Eden Park
thread.title_full: Airbnb gives rugby fans chance to sleep over at Eden Park

title: Airbnb gives rugby fans chance to sleep over at Eden Park
text:
Airbnb gives rugby fans chance to sleep over at Eden Park Last updated 10:50, July 24 2015 AIRBNB/YouTube 
Stay the night in a specially created All Blacks themed apartment in Eden Park stadium the night before watching the huge Bledisloe Cup clash with The Wallabies on Saturday, 15 August. 
All Black fans have the chance to win a never-before-offered sleepover at Eden Park as well as dinner and a game with a rugby legend. 
On offer is an all expenses paid night at the stadium as well as some quality time with former All Black Josh Kronfeld. 
New Zealand Rugby and Airbnb are offering four fans the chance to stay in a specially created All Blacks-themed apartment the night before the upcoming Bledisloe Cup clash with the Wallabies on August 15. 
Kronfeld said no fan had ever experienced sleeping over at Eden Park. 
With views across the stadium, the apartment has a double bed, bunks, a lounge and kitchen, flat screen televisions and a balcony. 
Winners won't just get the apartment though, they'll be treated to dinner with former All Black Josh Kronfeld as well as a kick around with him the next morning. 
They'll also get to watch the All Blacks and Australia fight it out on the pitch the next evening. 
The listing will be available from July 24 to August 8. 
Those who want a chance to win this experience can book for free though the site by submitting an answer of 25 words explaining why they want the prize. 
Kronfeld said no fan had ever experienced an overnight stay at Eden Park so he was sure this would be a dream come true for rugby fans. 
The listing will be available from July 24 to August 8 and winners will be announced on August 10.
